Second in command:

"Here Torka, report"replied a male voice
  ----- Origin=
al Message ----- 
  From: rm2kmidi 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: T=
uesday, September 20, 2005 10:09 PM
  Subject: Re: Celeron in the Lab


  A=
fter nearly a month of hard work, Celeron believed that he had completed a =
nearly perfect shield generator unit.  If they had a good computer, it coul=
d be hooked up and be fully computer controlled.  The shield, which was abo=
ut three times as strong as the older shield generator at the Pasificus Max=
imal base, was military grade and intended to be able to withstand heavy bo=
mbardment.  However, no shield is invincable, and it would be mearly a tool=
 to slow down and enemy attack. 

  Celeron had found several key parts in =
the lab, which had been salvaged from an old unit, but were severly damaged=
.  However, once these parts were restored, Celeron with the help of the la=
b technicians, was able to put together a masterpiece out of spare parts. 
=

  Celeron attempted to radio, whoever was in charge of the base at the mom=
ent.

  "Celeron to the control room....." he said in a quiet but urgent vo=
ice.

   
  On 9/1/05, rm2kmidi <kraftlos@...> wrote: 
    "Good..." =
said Celeron to himself as he finished working on the wiring and got to wor=
k on the main emitter.  

    He didn't have a good radial dish, so he bega=
n looking through a some metal parts for some good hunks of metal that he c=
ould melt down and make one himself.
     
    On 9/1/05, Airly <airly2002@=
hotmail.com> wrote: 
      Scientis:

      The scientists helped Celeron b=
ringing and repairing parts
        ----- Original Message ----- 
        F=
rom: rm2kmidi 
        To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
        Sent: Thursday, =
September 01, 2005 2:41 PM
        Subject: Re: Celeron

         
        =
"Yes.  Let's get to it!  We'll need to find these parts, even if they're br=
oken."

        He began to repair the parts that they were going to use to=
 get power to the shield, as they were broken and not very efficient.  He s=
eemed very focused on his task.

         
        On 8/31/05, Airly <airly=
2002@... > wrote: 
          Scientist:

          "Oh, have you re=
sted??? ready for work?"said the male
            ----- Original Message --=
--- 
            From: rm2kmidi 
            To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  =
          Sent: Wednesday, August 31, 2005 3:45 PM
            Subject: Cel=
eron

             
            About five hours later, Celeron emerged fro=
m his quarters and walked back to the lab.  Ready to start work.

         =
   He walked through the main door and looked around the room to see if any=
one was there.
